alert.note: Alert for Barry; McDonald; Newton (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 23 at 9:24PM CDT until March 24 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT FRIDAY FOR NORTHERN BARRY, MCDONALD AND SOUTHEASTERN NEWTON COUNTIES... At 924 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Neosho, Monett, Pineville, Granby, Anderson, Noel, Goodman, Purdy, South West City, Wheaton, Lanagan, Fairview, Dodge, Newtonia, Pioneer, Stella, Stark City, Powell, Rocky Comfort, Pleasant Ridge and Big Sugar Creek State Park. This includes the following low water crossings... Hickory Creek at Coler RD, Butler Creek at Kings Highway, Shoal Creek at Farm Road 2110, Buffalo Creek at Klondike Road, Elkhorn Creek at Highway CC, Little Sugar Creek at Skaggs Hollow Road and North Indian Creek at Orchid Drive. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
